ocrUtils

Class OCRUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • ocrUtils.OCRUtils
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Colors, OCR3D, Sandbox

    public class OCRUtils
extends Object
    OCRUtil is a collection of often used functions and such

    OCR

      • printStatus

        public static void printStatus(String functionName,
                               String notes)
        Will printStatus with a functionName, Notes, and the defaults - free & total memory (divided by 100000), frameRate, frameCount, and the last few stack trace elements
        Parameters:
        functionName - A String used for organizing the code. Just prints out the name
        notes - A String used for a manual description

      • splitStringIntoLines

        public static String[] splitStringIntoLines(String stringIn,
                                            float lineWidthIn,
                                            PFont fontIn)
        This will take in a String and split it up into a String[] according to the maximum width specified. Note: Don't use the special characters, ~ (option+9) and ` (option+7) in the text. Also note: if a single word is too long this will NOT break it up.. aka it will extend beyond the lineWidthIn
        Parameters:
        stringIn - The single String that will be split up
        lineWidthIn - The maximum width, in pixels, for each line
        fontIn - The Processing font that will be used to determine the line widths
        Returns:
        The String[] of the broken up line

      • getTimeStampWithDate

        public static String getTimeStampWithDate()
        This will return a timestamp with the date
        Returns:
        Something like 2013-10-15_17-41-23

      • getTimeStamp

        public static String getTimeStamp()
        This will return a timestamp
        Returns:
        Something like 17-41-23

      • generateRandomIndexArray

        public static ArrayList<Integer> generateRandomIndexArray(int count)
        This will return an ArrayList of type Integer for a specified count
        Parameters:
        count - The upper limit of the shuffled list
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of type Integer

        public static ArrayList shuffleArrayList(ArrayList listIn)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the shuffled ArrayList of type Object

      • sortObjectArrayListSimple

        public static ArrayList sortObjectArrayListSimple(ArrayList listIn,
                                                  String paramName)
        This will sort an ArrayList of Objects by a specified field.
        Parameters:
        listIn - The ArrayList of Objects
        paramName - String name of the field - note now works with int, long, float, double, char, and String
        Returns:
        The ascending ArrayList of Objects

        Parameters:
        listIn - The ArrayList to be reversed
        Returns:

      • countOccurrences

        public static IntDict countOccurrences(ArrayList listIn,
                                       String paramName)
        This will count the number of occurrences of a variable in an ArrayList of objects
        Parameters:
        listIn - The ArrayList of objects
        paramName - The String name of the param to be sorted
        Returns:
        An IntDict in ascending order by param occurrence

      • getFileNames

        public static String[] getFileNames(String fileDirectory,
                                    boolean goDeep)
        this function will get the file names for things that aren't directories
        Parameters:
        fileDirectory - .. use an actual path, most likely sketchPath("") + relative directory
        goDeep - Whether or not to go deeper into the system or stay at this folder level
        Returns:
        String array of files

      • getDirectoryNames

        public static String[] getDirectoryNames(String fileDirectory,
                                         boolean goDeep)
        this function will get the file names for things that are directories
        Parameters:
        fileDirectory - .. use an actual path, most likely sketchPath("") + relative directory
        goDeep - Whether or not to go deeper into the system or stay at this folder level
        Returns:
        String array of files
